name: Blue Cornbread
description: Blue cornmeal is sweeter and has a better nutritional profile than its yellow and white cousins. Try out blue cornmeal in this moist and tender blue cornbread! Adapted from Daily Garnish.

author.name: Cassie Johnston
author.description: Cassie is the founder and CEO of Wholefully. She's a home cook and wellness junkie with a love of all things healthy living. She lives on a small hobby farm in Southern Indiana with her husband, daughter, two dogs, two cats, and 15 chickens.

publisher.name: Wholefully
publisher.description: Fresh Family Meals - Made for Everyday Life

keywords: what to do with blue corn meal

recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 375°. In a medium mixing...
recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°. In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the cornmeal, flour, baking soda and salt, set aside.

recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, whisk together the yogurt,...
recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, whisk together the yogurt, eggs, butter, and milk. Pour into the cornmeal mixture and stir until just combined—do not overmix. Fold in the corn kernels.

recipeInstructions.name: Pour the batter into a well-seasoned cast iron...
recipeInstructions.text: Pour the batter into a well-seasoned cast iron skillet or a square baking dish. Bake in preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until the top is golden brown, and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
